member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotatePrintDocument
member.summary: This control derives from DotImage ImagePrintDocument and is used to print images with annotations.
member.remarks: The AnnotatePrintDocument can be used with the other printing .NET components for specifying page settings, printer settings, and a print preview. See the PrintDialog, PrintPreviewDialog, PrintPreviewControl, PrintDocument, and PageSetupDialog controls in the toolbox.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ImagePrintDocument
member.summary: Derives from and allows objects to be printed directly to a printer.

remarks.para: The .NET Framework contains the , , , and giving you fine control over printer settings and showing a preview of the output. Each of these uses a . The extends the so that you can take advantage of this functionality when printing images in DotImage.
Multiple images can be printed by setting the array property, or by handling the event and setting the property of the to true.

example.para: This example requires you have a placed an ImagePrintDocument onto your form. It demonstrates printing one image to the printer, and scaling it to fit the page.
example.code: myImagePrintDocument.Image = myImageViewer.Image myImagePrintDocument.ScaleMode = PrintScaleMode.FitToMargins myImagePrintDocument.Print()
example.para:
This example demonstrates how to print all images in a WorkspaceViewer to the printer while letting the user specify page and printer settings. By handling the PrintPage and AfterPrintPage events, it also demonstrates how to customize individual pages that are printed.
This example uses a WorkspaceViewer, ImagePrintDocument, PageSetupDialog, and PrintDialog in a WinForms application. The Document Property in the PageSetupDialog and PrintDialog must be set to the ImagePrintDocument.
example.code:
Private Sub imagePrintDocument1_PrintPage(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs) Handles imagePrintDocument1.PrintPage 'allows the user to customize page fitting for each page that's printed If MessageBox.Show(this,"Do you wish to fit this image to the page?","Specify Page Fitting",MessageBoxButtons.YesNo) = DialogResult.Yes Then imagePrintDocument1.ScaleMode = PrintScaleMode.FitToMargins Else imagePrintDocument1.ScaleMode = PrintScaleMode.None End If End Sub
Private Sub imagePrintDocument1_AfterPrintPage(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs) Handles imagePrintDocument1.AfterPrintPage 'draws a watermark on the page e.Graphics.DrawString("This is a test watermark.", New Font("Arial", 18), New SolidBrush(Color.Black), 0, 0) End Sub
Private Sub btnPrintImage_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnPrintImage.Click 'lets the user set the printer options If printDialog1.ShowDialog(Me) = DialogResult.OK Then 'set all images from the image collection imagePrintDocument1.SetImagesFromImageCollection(workspaceViewer1.Images) imagePrintDocument1.Print() End If End Sub
Private Sub btnPageSetup_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnPageSetup.Click 'lets the user modify the page settings such as margins pageSetupDialog1.ShowDialog(Me) End Sub

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.Viewport.ResolutionScaleMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how images with different X and Y resolutions are displayed.
member.value: A value indicating how images with different X and Y resolutions are displayed.
member.remarks: It is common for some FAX images to have a Y resolution that is smaller than the X resolution. It is intended that the height of these images be stretched for display. The ResolutionScaleMode property controls this behavior. The default mode is FAX which only adjusts the aspect ratio of images with binary images.

summary.para: The DocumentAnnotationViewer control simplifies the process of synchronizing a with an .
The control's can be docked on any side using the property. A can be enabled, allowing the end user to resize the and the will fill the rest of the control.
The control simplifies the process of synchronizing a with a .
The control's can be docked on any side using the property. A can be enabled, allowing the end user to resize the and the will fill the rest of the control.

Synchronization is performed using the class. When a thumbnail is selected, its full size image is loaded into the viewer where it can be modified. When an image is modified its thumbnail will be updated to match the change.

remarks.para: Advantages to using the control:

list.item: There is less code to write: All synchronization between the and controls is handled for you.
Images can be added from an , file, Stream or and are managed internally so there is no need to keep track of where an image is loaded from.
When images are modified they are saved to a temporary file, keeping the original image untouched. These temporary files are automatically deleted when the control is disposed.
Only one full size image is kept in memory at a time, resulting in lower memory overhead.

Private Sub menuOpen_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) ' The caption and tooltip for each page will ' be set in the OnThumbnailCaptionRequest method. Dim fs As FileStream = New FileStream("C:\images\multipage.tif", FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read, FileShare.Read) Try Me._viewer.Open(fs, New ThumbnailCaptionRequestEventHandler(OnThumbnailCaptionRequest)) Finally fs.Dispose() End Try End Sub
Private Sub OnThumbnailCaptionRequest(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As ThumbnailCaptionRequestEventArgs) e.Caption = "Image " & e.Index.ToString() e.ToolTip = "" End Sub

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.FolderThumbnailView
member.summary: A thumbnail list control designed to display thumbnails of images from a directory.

remarks.para: The control inherits from the control and displays a list of thumbnail images obtained from a directory of images by setting the property. The control will load and resample each image that passes the filter criteria defined in the property to the maximum width or height specified in , while keeping the original aspect ratio.

The is generally used a an image navigation utility, allowing all images located in a file system or network drive to be viewed as thumbnail images. When the thumbnail item is clicked, the associated page can be displayed in the associated , , , or event can be handled to respond to the thumbnail select or click.

This control automatically watches the file system for any changes such as adding, deleting, or renaming images. It updates the control appropriately. By default, all images are loaded Asynchronously thread pooling if is true. Therefore more than one images can be loading at once.

A custom background image can be displayed for each thumbnail by setting the property. Each thumbnail image will then be overlayed onto this image. Setting the property can enhance the visual style of the thumbnail view control.
For viewing thumbnails from an AtalaImage, such as viewing all pages in a multipage TIFF, the control may be a better choice.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailView
member.summary: A thumbnail list control designed to display thumbnails of objects, or image files.

remarks.para: The control displays a list of thumbnail images obtained from an image file, or directly from an . The control will resample the image passed into the Add method to the maximum width or height specified in , while keeping the original aspect ratio.

A common use of the control is to view the thumbnail of each page in a multipage TIFF image. When the thumbnail item is clicked, the associated page can be displayed in the associated control. The event can be handled to respond to the thumbnail select or click.

A custom background image can be displayed for each thumbnail by setting the property. Each thumbnail image will then be overlayed onto this image. Setting the property can enhance the visual style of the thumbnail view control.
For viewing thumbnails in a folder, the control is is better choice.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailView.SetDataBinding(Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailDataBinding)
member.summary: Sets up data binding for the .
member.returns: To disable data binding pass null (Nothing in VB) to this method.

example.code:
Private _table As DataTable Private Sub DataBindingExample() Dim dlg As FolderBrowserDialog = New FolderBrowserDialog() If dlg.ShowDialog(Me) = DialogResult.OK Then Me.thumbnailView1.Items.Clear()
Dim files() As String = System.IO.Directory.GetFiles(dlg.SelectedPath,"*.jpg") Dim count As Integer = files.Length If count = 0 Then dlg.Dispose() Return End If
_table = New DataTable() _table.Columns.Add("Filename", Type.GetType(String), "") _table.Columns.Add("Caption", Type.GetType(String), "")
Dim i As Integer For i = 0 To count - 1 _table.Rows.Add(New Object() { files(i), "File " + i.ToString() }) Next
Me.thumbnailView1.SetDataBinding(New Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailDataBinding(_table, "Filename", Nothing, "Caption", Nothing)) End If End Sub
example.para: The following example uses a custom class to hold the data members instead of a DataTable.
example.code:
' This class is used to hold data members. Public Class MyThumbnailData Private _filename As String Private _caption As String
Public Sub New(ByVal filename As String, ByVal caption As String) Me._filename = filename Me._caption = caption End Sub
Public Readonly Property FileName() As String Get Return Me._filename End Get End Property
Public Readonly Property Caption() As String Get Return Me._caption End Get End Property End Class
' Method - Place this in your class. Private _thumbData() As MyThumbnailData Private Sub CustomDataBindingExample() Dim dlg As FolderBrowserDialog = New FolderBrowserDialog() If dlg.ShowDialog(Me) = DialogResult.OK Then Me.thumbnailView1.Items.Clear()
Dim files() As String = System.IO.Directory.GetFiles(dlg.SelectedPath,"*.jpg") Dim count As Integer = files.Length If count = 0 Then dlg.Dispose() Return End If
_thumbData = New MyThumbnailData(count) {}
Dim i As Integer For i = 0 To count - 1 _thumbData(i) = New MyThumbnailData(files(i), "File " + i.ToString()) Next
Me.thumbnailView1.SetDataBinding(New Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailDataBinding(_thumbData, "FileName", Nothing, "Caption", Nothing)) End If dlg.Dispose() End Sub

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailView.AfterLabelEdit

remarks.para: The event occurs when the user finishes modifying the text for an item. The new string that the user types for the item is passed to the event, and the event handler can reject the change. If the event handler rejects the change, the text reverts to the text as it was before the user began editing the item. In order for the event to be raised, the property of the control must be set to true. You can create an event handler for the event to perform tasks before the user edits the text of an item.

member.summary: Occurs when the label for an item is edited by the user.

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailView.BeforeLabelEdit
member.summary: Occurs when the user starts editing the label of an item.
member.remarks: The event occurs when the user begins modifying the text for an item. If the event handler cancels this event, the user cannot edit the text. You can use this event to prevent the user from editing specific items in the control. If the property of the control is set to false, the event is not raised; all user attempts to edit item labels are automatically rejected.

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailView.SelectedIndexChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the selected thumbnail index changes.
member.remarks: Handle this event to respond to the user clicking or navigating to a thumbnail with the keyboard in order to view the full size image in an associated control.

example.code: Private Sub thumbnailView1_SelectedIndexChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles thumbnailView1.SelectedIndexChanged If thumbnailView1.SelectedIndices.Count > 0 Then workspaceViewer1.Open(_currentFile, thumbnailView1.SelectedIndices(0)) End If End Sub

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailView.BeforeThumbnailLoad
member.summary: Raised just before a thumbnail image is going to be created.

remarks.para: Handle this event to override the thumbnail load process. By setting the property of the , you can load the image with customized decoder settings. If you are using a custom decoder that has a special method for obtaining thumbnails, write the thumbnail load code in this event handler.
The event can also be used to obtain a reference to the for the image being loaded in order to show progress of each thumbnail as it's loaded.
The property of the can be set to true to prevent the thumbnail to be loaded into the control.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ImageCompositePrintDocument
member.summary: Allows multiple images to be printed per page at typical metric and English photo sizes.

remarks.para: This component requires the event to be handled (or method overridden). In the event handler, pass an into the to be printed. Set the property to true when there are more images to print.

Minimum page margins will be used when calculating the image position. You may override the position and size of the printed image by changing the property of the . The image will always be rotated to fit.
A caption can be printed beneath each image by setting the property of .

By default, images will be cropped to fit the aspect ratio of the printed size. However setting the property to false will instead scale the image to fit the image bounds, keeping the original aspect ratio of the image.

example.code:
Private _folders() As String
'handle this event to tell the printer component what images to print Private Sub imageCompositePrintDocument1_PrintImage(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.PrintCompositeEventArgs) Handles imageCompositePrintDocument1.PrintImage If Not _folders Is Nothing And _folders.Length > e.ImageIndex Then 'specify the image to print e.Image = New AtalaImage(_folders(e.ImageIndex)) 'specify the caption of the image e.Caption = System.IO.Path.GetFileName(_folders(e.ImageIndex)) End If
'tell Print Document if there are more images/pages to print after this one If e.ImageIndex >= _folders.Length - 1 Then e.HasMorePages = False Else e.HasMorePages = True End If End Sub
'handle this event to dispose the image that's no longer needed Private Sub imageCompositePrintDocument1_AfterPrintImage(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.PrintCompositeEventArgs) Handles imageCompositePrintDocument1.AfterPrintImage If Not e.Image Is Nothing Then e.Image.Dispose() End If End Sub
'print the images Private Sub btnPrint_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) If Me.printDialog1.ShowDialog(Me) = DialogResult.OK Then 'get images from a folder _folders = System.IO.Directory.GetFiles("c:\photos", "*.jpg") Me.imageCompositePrintDocument1.Print() End If End Sub

example.code: Private Sub imageCompositePrintDocument1_AfterPrintImage(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.PrintCompositeEventArgs) Handles imageCompositePrintDocument1.AfterPrintImage If Not e.Image Is Nothing Then e.Image.Dispose() End If End Sub

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ImageCompositePrintDocument.PrintImage
member.summary: Occurs before an image is printed during the printing process.
member.remarks: This event must be handled or nothing will be printed. Set the members to specify the image to print, the caption of the image, and to indicate if there are any more images to print.

example.code:
Private Sub imageCompositePrintDocument1_PrintImage(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.PrintCompositeEventArgs) Handles imageCompositePrintDocument1.PrintImage If _folders <> Nothing And _folders.Length > e.ImageIndex Then 'specify the image to print e.Image = New AtalaImage(_folders(e.ImageIndex)) 'specify the caption of the image e.Caption = System.IO.Path.GetFileName(_folders(e.ImageIndex)) End If
'tell Print Document if there are more images/pages to print after this one If e.ImageIndex >= _folders.Length - 1 Then e.HasMorePages = False Else e.HasMorePages = True End If End Sub

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.OpenImageFileDialog.AddExtension
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box automatically adds an extension to a file name if the user omits the extension.
member.value: true if the dialog box adds an extension to a file name if the user omits the extension; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: The extension added to a file name depends on the currently selected file filter and the value of the property.

If the CheckFileExists property is true, the dialog box adds the first extension from the current file filter that matches an existing file. If no files match the current file filter, the dialog box adds the extension specified in the property.

If the CheckFileExists property is false, the dialog box adds the first valid file name extension from the current file filter. If the current file filter contains no valid file name extensions, the dialog box adds the extension specified in the DefaultExt property.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays a warning if the user specifies a file name that does not exist.

value.para: true if the dialog box displays a warning when the user specifies a file name that does not exist; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.OpenImageFileDialog.CheckPathExists
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays a warning if the user specifies a path that does not exist.

value.para: true if the dialog box displays a warning when the user specifies a path that does not exist; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.OpenImageFileDialog.ValidateNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box accepts only valid Win32 file names.
member.value: true if the dialog box accepts only valid Win32 file names; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If the edit control contains anything but spaces when the user clicks OK, the dialog returns the file name, whether it is valid or not. No default extension is added to the text.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.OpenImageFileDialog.ShowHelp
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Help button is displayed in the file dialog.
member.value: true if the dialog box includes a help button; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailCollection.AddRange(Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.Thumbnail[])
member.summary: Adds an array of objects to the collection.
member.remarks: Use this method when several thumbnails need to be added at once.

example.code:
Private Sub LoadFromFolder(ByVal folder As String) Dim files() As String = System.IO.Directory.GetFiles(folder,"*.jpg") Dim count As Integer = files.Length If count = 0 Then Return End If
Dim thumbnails() As Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.Thumbnail = New Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.Thumbnail(count) {} Dim i As Integer For i = 0 To count- 1 Step i + 1 thumbnails(i) = New Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.Thumbnail(files(i), 0, System.IO.Path.GetFileName(files(i)), "") Next
Me.thumbnailView1.Items.AddRange(thumbnails) End Sub

member.param: An array of items to add.

member.summary: Specifies the rendering style for selected items.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SelectedItemRenderStyle.None
member.summary: No selection is drawn.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SelectedItemRenderStyle.Default
member.summary: A highlight is placed below the image area and below the caption area with a space between the image and caption areas.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SelectedItemRenderStyle.Full
member.summary: The entire thumbnail is highlighted.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SelectedItemRenderStyle.Extended
member.summary: The highlight is extended two pixels outside of the thumbanil area.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SelectedItemRenderStyle.DefaultAboveBackground
member.summary: Same as Default except that the highlight is rendered on top of the thumbnail background.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SelectedItemRenderStyle.FullAboveBackground
member.summary: Same as Full except that the highlight is rendered on top of the thumbnail background.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SelectedItemRenderStyle.ExtendedAboveBackground
member.summary: Same as Extended except that the highlight is rendered on top of the thumbnail background.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbLoadMethod
member.summary: Determines the method used to load thumbnails in .
member.remarks: If is used, the viewer will only load thumbnails when scrolling after the scrollbar thumb or button has been released.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbLoadMethod.EntireFolder
member.summary: Loads all thumbnails in the folder.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbLoadMethod.WhenVisible
member.summary: Loads the thumbnails only when they become visible in the viewer. This option is suggested when the folder contains a large number of images.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailLayout
member.summary: This enumeration is used with the property to indicate the layout of the thumbnails.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailLayout.Vertical
member.summary: The thumbnails are ordered from left to right, top to bottom. A vertical scrollbar will be displayed when needed.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbnailLayout.Horizontal
member.summary: The thumbnails are ordered from top to bottom, left to right. A horizontal scrollbar will be displayed when needed.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.ThumbViewAttribute
member.summary: Specifies values for the and properties.

summary.para: : No text is displayed.
: No sorting is performed.
: The filename is displayed.
: As files are added, they are sorted by their filenames.
: The last date the file was modified is displayed.
: The files are sorted by their last modified date.
: The file size is displayed.
: The files are sorted by their file size.
: The type of file is displayed.
: The files are sorted by their type.
: The display text is shown.
: The thumbnails are sorted by their display name.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SortOrder.Ascending
member.summary: The thumbnails are displayed in ascending order.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.SortOrder.Descending
member.summary: The thumbnails are displayed in descending order.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.DragDropMode
member.summary: This enumeration dictates the type of drag and drop operation to perform. If the source control is the same one that the thumbnails are being dropped onto, these values are ignored and the thumbnails are simply reordered.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.DragDropMode.Move
member.summary: The thumbnails will be removed from the previous ThumbnailView and moved to the control they were dropped on.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.WinControls.DragDropMode.Copy
member.summary: A copy of the thumbnails are added to the destination control, leaving the original thumbnails in the source control.
